PeriodicSyncEvent.summary: NOTE Experimental The PeriodicSyncEvent interface of the provides a way to run tasks in the service worker with network connectivity.

remarks.para: An instance of this event is passed to the handler. This happens periodically, at an interval greater than or equal to that set in the method. Other implementation-specific factors such as the user's engagement with the site decide the actual interval.

-Richer offline experiences with the Periodic Background Sync API
-A Periodic Background Sync demo app

PeriodicSyncEventPeriodicSyncEvent.summary:
NOTE Experimental The PeriodicSyncEvent() constructor
creates a new object. This constructor is not typically
used. The browser creates these objects itself and provides them to
callback.

remarks.para:
-Richer offline experiences with the Periodic Background Sync API
-A Periodic Background Sync demo app

PeriodicSyncEventPeriodicSyncEvent.returns: A new object configured using the given inputs.

PeriodicSyncEventTag.summary:
NOTE Experimental The tag read-only property of the
interface returns the developer-defined identifier for
the . This is specified when calling the
method of the
interface. Multiple tags can be used by the web app
to run different periodic tasks at different frequencies.

remarks.para:
-Richer offline experiences with the Periodic Background Sync API
-A Periodic Background Sync demo app

PeriodicSyncEventTag.value: Returns a of the defined identifier.
